channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole about 5-6m long, 31st March
item.description:
Visibly along the length of the start of Lyefield Road East

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lyefield Road East, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking Enforcement, 31st March
item.description:
Parking rules are not obeyed here, one vehicle in particular has been parked for well over the 2 hours stated on signage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in Foxcote Lane 2x1 feet across and 2 inches deep, 31st March
item.description:
Pothole in Foxcote Lane approx 15 metres down from junction with track to Cabin Farm what3words ref curry.radically.scarves

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold

item.title: Pothole in Foxcote Lane 2x1 ft across and 2 inches deep, 31st March
item.description:
Pothole in road on Foxcote Village Lane at track junction with track to Cabin Farm What 3 words bride.alerting.equipping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold

item.title: The road at the top of Harp Hill close to junction with Birdlip Rd is badly degraded, 31st March
item.description:
Recent patch repairs at the top of Harp Hill close to Birdlip Road junction have been made recently but sections in between the repairs of badly degraded road surface have been left untouched. The road surface is very uneven and a more comprehensive repair is required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more flytipping, 31st March
item.description:
Between 1;00 pm Sunday and 8;00 am Monday at single mattress and 2 pieces of furniture have been dumped in the usual spot on the corner of Pates Avenue & Alstone Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW6 problem, 31st March
item.description:
CWPH STATS REQUIRED AROUND IRONWORKS 800 X 300 X 40m 2 WAY TRAFFIC LIGHTS MARKED AS NUMBER 1 (CW6 Edge Deterioration)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 31st March
item.description:
Sign has come loose and dropped down pole. Unable to tighten and re fit myself. Can you please pass on to the AHR for the area to arrange reinstatement
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Bollard shell is damaged/vandalised (Non illuminating bollard or post) problem, 31st March
item.description:
Customer reports that a bollard, in the middle of the carriageway at the location, has been ripped out and deposited to its side. They are concerned that the hole/remnants are a trip hazard for pedestrians.
Report on FixMyStreet
